title: Hint
text:
1) We begin with the given normal distribution X ~ N(170, $$6.28)$$, where the mean μ $$=$$ $$170$$ cm and the standard deviation σ $$=$$ $$6.28$$ cm.

2) The formula for the $$z-score$$ of a given value $$x$$ is:
$$z$$ $$=$$ (x - μ) / σ

3) Substituting $$x$$ $$=$$ $$168$$ cm, μ $$=$$ $$170$$ cm, and σ $$=$$ $$6.28$$ cm:
$$z$$ $$=$$ (168 - 170) / $$6.28$$
$$z$$ $$=$$ $$(-2)$$ / $$6.28$$
$$z$$ ≈ $$-0.318$$

4) Hence, the male’s height of $$168$$ cm is approximately $$0.318$$ standard deviations to the left of the mean of $$170$$ cm.
